comments.body: As far as I know, `any` is bad practice. In reality, `reporter` could only be a `function` or a `string`, as seen in [this section of the README](https://github.com/ilyakam/gulp-pug-linter#external-reporter).
so, `string | (...args: any[]) => any` or maybe `string | Function` ?
@ilyakam, linter will not pass the `Function`  type. I suppose, it we don't know at advance the possible types of function arguments and type of returning value, `any` is inevitable.

`(...args: any[]) => any` works for any function that Typescript has a type for. It doesn't work for variables with the explicit type `Function`, though.

I think this is good enough to merge, but you should test the above type and see if it works well enough, then submit a follow-up PR.
